page.title: 11STAVERTON BY-PASS
page.content: The village of Staverton is linear, running along the B3105 road. There is a narrow, stone bridge on a sharp bend where the road crosses the River Avon outside the Nestles Factory. Lots of large lorries use the road. When the school did a traffic survey, we found that most of the lorries were passing through the village and not going to the Nestles factory, as we had thought. Most of the villagers want a by-pass but they did not vote for either of the two routes planned by the West Wilts District Council. Instead, they would like the council to consider a by-pass that went straight from the Canal Road Industrial Estate in Trowbridge to Forwards Common and missing the village by half a mile. Meanwhile, people are worried that the bridge is unsafe for heavy traffic.
